quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Beatles and U.s.
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, pink, gold. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This female singer was pretty much down and out on her luck due to poor album sales in the 1970s. She had a resurgence in 1989,  just in a Nick of Time. In 1991 she had a smash hit song (#5 in the U.S. ) called Something to Talk About.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bonnie Raitt

questions.question: What year were The Beatles formed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1959

questions.question: This female singer had a #1 hit with her group The Blackhearts in 1982. The name of the song was I Love Rock N Roll.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joan Jett

questions.question: This superstar who dominated the 80s wanted to Dress You up and Live to Tell about it.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Madonna

questions.question: Who was the first member of The Beatles to wear his hair in the long shaggy style that came to be known as The Beatle Haircut?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stu Sutcliffe

questions.question: This 80s German born one-hit wonder struck gold in 1984 with the smash hit song 99 Luft Balloons.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nena

questions.question: Which was one of the most successful folk-singing groups of the 1960s, inducted into the Vocal Group Hall of Fame in 1999?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter, Paul and Mary

questions.question: This female Cuban-born singer was the lead singer for a band out of the Miami area. She burst onto the scene in 1985 with the smash hit single Conga ( #10 in the U.S.). What is the name of this Latin Queen of Pop?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gloria Estefan

questions.question: Who was the original drummer of the popular rock group The Beatles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pete Best

questions.question: This female singer burst onto the scene in 1988 with her smash hit Fast Car (#6 in the U.S. ).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tracy Chapman

questions.question: What was the last # 1song by The Beatles to hit the U.S charts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Long And Winding Road

questions.question: In 1965, The Beatles performed in New York City, at what venue?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shea Stadium

questions.question: This pop-rock singer started performing at the age of 12 and by the time he reached 19, he had a million seller with Hanky Panky.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tommy James

questions.question: This female singer loved you for your Pink Cadillac in 1988.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Natalie Cole

questions.question: This 80s music legend was born in Brooklyn, New York and had several top 10 hits in the 70s. Her hit Shadows of the Night reached # 13 on the U.S. charts in 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pat Benatar

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Beatles and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, country, line. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On April 10th 1970, which member of The Beatles publicly announced the breakup of the band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul McCartney

questions.question: What country music singer recorded the 45rpm single, Young Love 1956?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sonny James

questions.question: What was the name of the first Beatles movie?

options.text: Sgt. Peppers Lonely Hearts Club Band

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Hard Days Night

questions.question: He scored an unexpected hit on the charts in 1955 with his version of Merle Travis Sixteen Tons.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tennessee Ernie Ford

questions.question: What American country singer, known for his distinctive voice sang White Lightning in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Jones

questions.question: What influential country musician performed the number one single, Hey Good-Looking in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hank Williams, Sr.

questions.question: What album by The Beatles includes the songs Come Together and Maxwells Silver Hammer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abbey Road

questions.question: What country music singer performed the breakthrough hit, Walkin after Midnight in 1957?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Patsy Cline

questions.question: What country musician sang the song, Waterloo in the 1950s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stonewall Jackson

questions.question: Who recorded the song, I Walk The Line in 1955, which tells the story of the singer, staying faithful to his wife while on the road.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Cash

questions.question: The popular group The Beatles were awarded the MBE (Member Of The Order Of The British Empire) on October 26th 1965 at The Buckingham Palace.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was the name of the first  American television show, on which the popular rock group The Beatles appeared?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Ed Sullivan Show

questions.question: What musician recorded the song, Heartbreak Hotel in January, 1956?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elvis Presley

questions.question: Who was the manager of the popular rock group The Beatles?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brian Epstein

questions.question: What was John Lennons middle name at birth?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Winston

options.text: d nobodys waiting by your side?

questions.question: Sometimes I think that a true love can never be

questions.question: When Im feeling blue, all I have to do

questions.question: Ill be there for you, these five words I swear to you

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Band
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, vocals, female. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Kevin Bacon and his brother, Michael, are well respected musicians. Their band has played with Hall  Oates and opened for The Band at Carnegie Hall. What is the name of their band?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bacon Brothers

questions.question: This 90s female singer recorded the smash hit You Were Meant for Me in 1997.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jewel

questions.question: This former Miss America had lots of success in the music industry. Her Save the Best for Last was a #1 song in 1992.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanessa Williams

questions.question: Who sang the song Seasons in the Sun, which rose to number one in the USA in 1974?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terry Jacks

questions.question: This Grammy Award-winning female artist had a smash hit in 1999 with Baby One More Time, a song which ultimately catapulted her to fame.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Britney Spears

questions.question: Who performed the hit single Sundown, included in the self-titled 1974 album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gordon Lightfoot

questions.question: In the 90s, this female singers debut album Jagged Little Pill sold over 30 million copies and spawned the #1 hit Hand in My Pocket.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alanis Morissette

questions.question: Which group became famous in 1999 for the song Steal My Sunshine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Len

questions.question: House of the Rising Sun became the signature song of which band formed in the early 1960s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Animals

questions.question: Which grunge band recorded the 1994 song Black Hole Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Soundgarden

questions.question: This Christian female singer had a smash hit single in 1991 with Baby, Baby that reached #1 in the U.S.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amy Grant

questions.question: Which group recorded the melancholy ballad Ill Follow the Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beatles

questions.question: This female artist provided the vocals for the 90s band The Fugees. She went on to have a #1 hit in 1998 with the song Doo Wop(That Thing).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lauryn Hill

questions.question: Who sang the 1982 song Blister in the Sun?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Violent Femmes

questions.question: Who recorded the song Sunshine on My Shoulders released in 1973?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Denver

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Band and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, fighters, pop. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these bands is known for the smash hit Walking on Sunshine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Katrina and the Waves

questions.question: Which of these is a British electronic music band named after a French fashion magazine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Depeche Mode

questions.question: Who wrote and performed the popular song Dont Let the Sun Go Down on Me?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Elton John

questions.question: The name of Australian singing trio Bee Gees appeared in which of these ways?

options.text: It was made up by Bill Gates.
It is a reference to their mutual penchant for bees.
They named themselves after their favourite car brand name.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It was made up by Bill Gates.

questions.question: What band out of the state of New Jersey was Livin on a Prayer in 1987?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bon Jovi

questions.question: The name of hip hop band N.E.R.D is loosely based on a reference to a law in which of these scientific fields?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thermodynamics

questions.question: Foo Fighters derived their name from a term used by pilots from the Allied forces during World War II to describe what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Unidentified Flying Objects

questions.question: The name of post-grunge rock band Nickelback is related to which of these aspects of its bass guitarists life?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Work

questions.question: American hip hop performer James Todd Smith III is better known by his stage name, LL Cool J, which stands for what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ladies Love Cool James

questions.question: What group had a #1 hit in 1987 with the song Alone?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heart

questions.question: What #1 song from 1987 was featured in the smash hit movie  Dirty Dancing ?

options.text: ( Ive Had) the Time of My Life

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ( Ive Had) the Time of My Life

questions.question: American electronic musician Moby owes his name to his great-great-granduncle whose profession was what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Writer

questions.question: Australian pop duo Savage Garden owe their name to what work of art?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A novel

questions.question: English heavy metal band Iron Maiden is named after a historic female character from the medieval European witchcraft folklore.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The members of rock duo The White Stripes, Jack and Meg White, wanted their band name to symbolize childhood and innocence. To which of these is the bands name related?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A candy
